text: in 2013 i was working as a software
developer
at a company that was an all-in aws
customer
around that time a colleague from an
open source community tweeted about
linux jobs at aws i immediately applied
and i was so stoked when i received the
invitation for the phone screen
that i immediately quit my job to give
myself a better chance at preparing for
the interview
it was a risky move but it was worth it
i joined our dresden germany office
and happily lived there for 18 months my
team was all based in seattle
my manager invited me to come and
experience life on the mothership
but i always knew that i wanted to come
back to europe
today i am a senior software development
manager for ec2 here in cambridge
ec2 is a web service that provides
secure
resizable computing capacity in the
cloud
it is designed to make compute for the
masses
very cheap and infinitely scalable the
most exciting part of my job is
without a doubt the impact ecto has on
life for so many people
often without them knowing in the last
year
the ability to quickly scale compute
workloads to tens of thousands of
instances
has been crucial in the research for the
kovite 19 vaccine
earlier this year ec2 and aws were key
technologies
used by the mars rover team so we're not
just having a global impact
but we're doing work that is completely
out of this world
